column4: ok so i have a external hdd split into 2 primary partitions lets call them E and F. on E i have standard none bootable data on F i have extracted the ubuntu iso. will it boot F automatically or do i have to flag that as the boot partition some how?
i'm in windows so not using gparted im using easeus partition master
yh but i have multiple partitions
you cant only extract the iso to the partition. never tried usb-hdd but unetbootin should work with that too, try it
